alert.note: Alert for Craig; Creek; Nowata; Osage; Pawnee; Washington (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 31 at 3:51AM CDT until June 04 at 1:27PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, Craig, Creek, Nowata, Osage, Pawnee and Washington OK. * WHEN...From this evening through late Wednesday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Multiple rounds of showers and thunderstorms are forecast starting late this afternoon and continuing into Wednesday night as slow moving cold front enters the region. Widespread 1 to 3 inches and locally higher amounts around 4 inches will be possible within the watch area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Craig; Creek; Nowata; Osage; Pawnee; Washington
